verbose_text: In an effort to better understand melanocyte responses to ECM substrates, we next addressed whether melanocytes exhibit different responses when stimulated by laminin-332 or collagen I. Because laminin binding integrins can mediate cellular responses distinct from those elicited by fibronectin- or collagen binding integrins, we first compared the morphology and ability of primary mouse melanocytes to migrate on no exogenous ECM, low or intermediate concentrations of collagen I (5 mug/cm 2 or 15 mug/cm 2), or laminin-332 isolated from 804G rat bladder epithelial cells.
